Actions.ActionName: Window size and location settings and calcs

Actions.Text:
Welcome to MacroBackerUpper (MBU) version 2.9
[Release notes are at the bottom of this window.]

Overview

Given you've installed this macro, you probably have a good sense for what it does: Creates Time-Machine-like backups of your macro collection. To get started, please read the help page for full details on using MBU:

https://robservatory.com/macro_versions/macrobackerupper/mbuhelp.html

If you don't want to dive into the help, at least read the basic info you'll find in the Info: Read Me First! macro; it will get you started with MBU, and gives credit to those who helped make this a reality.

The main macro is •main | MacroBackerUpper, which is bound to Control-Option-Keypad * by default, but can be changed. Run this to run your first backup, which will include a boring report (in the backup folder) saying the first backup is done. Do some work in Keyboard Maestro, then run it again, and this time you'll see a more interesting report detailing the changes between backups.

The help file includes a couple of options for running MBU automatically, or you could enable the •main | Reminder macro to just remind yourself to run MBU every so often.

If you have any questions about the macro, feel free to contact me via the Keyboard Maestro forums.

──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Things to be aware of…

Default Folder X users: Version 2.4 and newer of MBU disables Default Folder X while the backup is being made, as otherwise it will probably fail to work. It then re-enables Default Folder X when the backup is done. It has to use AppleScript to do this, though, so the first time you run version 2.4 or newer, you'll see a dialog asking for permission for Keyboard Maestro to control Default Folder X.

Please click OK so that Keyboard Maestro can disable and enable Default Folder X on each backup run—you'll only see this dialog once, but if you click Don't Allow, MacroBackerUpper will not work.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────
WARNING FOR USERS OF 1.x VERSIONS OF MBU:

The 2.x version of MacroBackerUpper updates the database with new data fields. As such, the first run of a 2.x version will create a full (no hard links) backup, and won't include a comparison report.

If you need a comparison report due to recent changes in your macros and are still using 1.4, please re-run that version of MacroBackerUpper before running this version.
───────────────────────────────────────────────────

Last three releases: Notes

Feb 12 2024: 2.9

	▪	Duplicate-name and dot-named macros are now saved to files on the drive, so the user can see all such names in one pass.

Jan 11 2024: 2.8

	▪	Fixed some out-of-date references in various macros (not functional issues, just documentation-related).

	▪	Fixed broken reference to the show-on-first-run macro.

Dec 21 2023: 2.7

	▪	Trimmed a disk space usage variable that escaped previous trimming attempts.

	▪	Forgot to add a trigger check before attempting to close the task list window. This would generate an error in the Keyboard Maestro log file. Trigger check now added.

Read the full release notes for all versions online.

Actions.Title: Click OK when you're ready to begin…
Actions.ActionName: Show the dialog that prevents the macro from running on its own
Actions.Prompt:
After reading the instructions above, click OK in that window to dismiss it, then click OK in this dialog to start the macro.

NOTE: If you're a prior user of MacroBackerUpper 1.x, an upgrade script will run when you click OK. If you'd like one more backup with comparisons first, click Cancel and run the old version once more!

(Only the first post-upgrade backup will lack comparisons; they'll return with the next.)

Actions.ActionName: If both globals exist, but the Settings database does not, assume upgrader

ConditionList.ScriptText: if [ ! -f "$KMVAR_rg_MBU_BackupLoc"/"zSupport Files - Do not delete"/"zSettings.db" ]; then echo "nosettings"; fi

ThenActions.ActionName: Set the path to the Settings database
Set the path to the Macros database
Split old global into usable variables
Write new settings to the database

Actions.Text:
UPDATE s_MacroBackerUpper
SET
    Backup_Qty = %Variable%instance_BackupQty%,
    Hard_Links = '%Variable%instance_UseHardLinks%',
    Show_Timing = '%Variable%instance_ShowTiming%',
    Show_Summary = '%Variable%instance_ShowDialog%',
    Warn_Dupes = '%Variable%instance_WarnDupes%',
    Warn_Invisibles = '%Variable%instance_WarnInvis%'
